column4: I've installed and un-installed, and then re-installed libiw-dev and still xsupplicant is telling me that I don't have the iwlib.h file. Anybody know what's going on?
it doesn't seem to be doing anything. just a blinking cursor on the line after the command.
ok, so it might be an issue with xsupplicant then
is there any way to point xsupplicant in the right direction?
not sure, I assume you are compiling, see if there is anything in the README or INSTALL or ./configure --help
I can't imagine it would be looking anywhere other than /usr/include
any idea on how i would get rid of an old installation of xsupplicant if i had already successfully compiled and installed it?
you would need to recompile it and then instead of make install do make uninstall
or track down all the files and delete them
thanks. i think i'll go with the first option :)

when I used to compile stuff, I would put the directory I compiled it in in /opt since that tends to be unused and then when I needed to uninstall just cd into it and make uninstall sort of a little impromptu package management setup

this is quite rediculous. i went and found the older version of xsupplicant so i could remove it, and now when i try to configure it it's telling me that /linux/wireless.h isn't there, even though it is.
and at one point in time, it obviously located it correctly because i have it installed right now.
